Package com.cafean.client.anim

Class AbstractDisplayBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • com.cafean.client.anim.AbstractDisplayBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentListener, ModelElement, EuChangeListener, TransientDataChangeListener, Insertable, DrawingLayerElement, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractRangedBean
    public abstract class AbstractDisplayBean
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements EuChangeListener, TransientDataChangeListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable, ComponentListener, ModelElement, Insertable, DrawingLayerElement
    An abstract class providing functionality required to connect to data sources, animate visual components, and to provide interactive control of calculations.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • store

        public boolean store​(DrawnDisplayElementRec rec)
        Attempts to store this display bean into the given block. Beans that support this feature must override this method to save the additional properties available in the bean and return true to indicate the support.
        Parameters:
        rec - the DrawnDisplayElementRec to store this bean into
        Returns:
        true if this bean supports this feature or false if the legacy XMLEncode method should be used instead.
        See Also:
        getProperty(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, String), setProperty(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, String), getBoolProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, boolean), setBoolProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, boolean), getIntProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, int), setIntProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, int), getColorProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, Color), setColorProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, Color), getFontProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, Font), setFontProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, Font), getBorderProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, Border), setBorderProp(String, DrawnDisplayElementRec, Border)

      • reconnectDataSources

        public void reconnectDataSources​(AbstractModel sourceModel,
                                 AbstractModel targetModel)
        Reconnects this display bean's data source to referr to the data source in the given model with the same name.

        This base implementation is sufficient for any display bean that has only a single DataSource. Beans that make use of multiple data sources must override this method to properly handle the paste process.

        This method is used by the CAFEAN Copy/Paste system and should not be necessary in any other situations.

      • findMasterDataSource

        public static DataSource findMasterDataSource​(AbstractModel model)
        Finds the most recently created master data source in this bean's animation model.

      • reconnectIdentReferences

        public void reconnectIdentReferences​(boolean preserveUnresolved,
                                     boolean useDbId)
        Resets this component's internal ident references to refer to appropriate components in the current AbstractModel. Intended for use after adding a component to a model and thus it's DB_ID will have been set to it's ident in the previous model. For ident references use find__ByDbId to find the new component, then store it's ident.

        Note: If this component's DB_ID is 0 this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        preserveUnresolved - if true, ident references that aren't resolvable will be left dangling, if false, they will be set to 0.
        useDbId - if true, ident references will be reconnected via find_x_ByDB_ID; if false, ident references will be reconnected via find_x_ByIdent
        See Also:
        AbstractModel.getNewComponentIdent(int, com.cafean.client.analysis.Category, boolean, boolean)

      • allocateChannels

        public DrawnDisplayBeanRec store()
        Creates a DrawnDisplayBeanRec for use in storing this bean into an MED file. The bulk of this method is implemented in Toolbox.storeDisplayBean(com.cafean.client.anim.AbstractDisplayBean).

      • getNativeUnits

        public int getNativeUnits()
        Returns the native units enumeration value used by this bean's current data source and client code plugin. Note: If no data source is connected, Real.SI wil be returned instead.
        Returns:
        either Real.SI or Real.BRITISH, the return from {ClientCodePlugin#getNativeUnits}

      • getGroupID

        Sets the ID of this object's visual group.

        NOTE: For this feature to be used this object must implement Groupable.

      • isGroupIDValid

        public boolean isGroupIDValid()
        Returns true if this object's visual group ID is valid. Valid visual group IDs are not reconnected during a paste operation.

        NOTE: For this feature to be used this object must implement Groupable.

      • setGroupIDValid

        public void setGroupIDValid​(boolean valid)
        Sets the flag that is used to determine if this object's visual group ID must be reconnected after a paste operation.

        NOTE: For this feature to be used this object must implement Groupable.

                                          java.awt.Color defValue)

        Parameters:

        rec - the DrawnDisplayElementRec to retrieve the color from
        defValue - a Color to use as the default value

        See Also:
        Color(int)

        Overrides:
        setBorder in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • validWithoutChannel

        public boolean validWithoutChannel()
        This method identifies a display bean that is still valid if the channel names contain a -not set- entry. This prevents error messages for these display beans from appearing when validating an animation model.

      • validWithoutDataSource

        public boolean validWithoutDataSource()
        Determines if the given display bean requires the user to define a single data source. This allows for custom beans to handle the data source reference their own way.
